data.enText: to show your approval of sb/sth by clapping your hands

data.chText: 他开始鼓掌，其他人也跟着鼓起掌来。
data.enText: He started to applaud and the others joined in.

data.chText: 他们起立向演讲者鼓掌。
data.enText: They rose to applaud the speaker.

data.chText: 她上台时人们向她鼓掌。
data.enText: She was applauded as she came on stage.
to express praise for sb/sth because you approve of them or it

data.chText: 他为改善状况所作的努力应该受到赞许。
data.enText: His efforts to improve the situation are to be applauded.
I applaud her for having the courage to refuse.

simple_means.memory_skill: ap 加强 + plaud 拍手，鼓掌 → 使劲鼓掌 → 拍手喝彩

ex.chText: 他们热烈欢呼大会开幕。
ex.enText: They warmly acclaimed the opening of the conference.

ex.chText: 人们欢呼称颂他这一历史性决定。

synonyms.bx: 指因某人或某事成就巨大或名声显赫而为其大声欢呼。

ex.chText: 球迷们为自己的球队鼓掌喝彩。
工人们鼓掌欢迎来访者。

synonyms.bx: 指鼓掌欢迎，表示极大的赞同。

ex.chText: 他赢得这场比赛时，人群大声欢呼起来。
ex.enText: The crowd cheered as he won the race.

ex.chText: 球迷们为他们的球队加油。
ex.enText: The fans cheered their team to victory.

synonyms.bx: 指大声呼叫，表示鼓励、祝贺或喝彩。

ex.chText: 支持者兴高采烈地向他们的总统欢呼。
ex.enText: The supporters hailed their president with joy.

ex.chText: 该经理由于支持员工而受到热情赞扬。
ex.enText: The manager was hailed for supporting the staff.

synonyms.bx: 指大声喊出某人的名字或头衔以示喝彩。

ex.chText: 她因乐于助人而受到老师的表扬。
ex.enText: She was praised by her teacher for being ready to help others.

ex.chText: 州长称赞了他的大无畏行为。
ex.enText: The governor praised him for his act of great bravery.

ex.chText: 他为提高个税起征点的决定拍手叫好。
ex.enText: He applauded the decision to raise the income tax threshold.

ex.chText: 她的宽宏大量应当受到赞许。
ex.enText: She should be applauded for her generosity.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈赞成、认同某个想法、计划等。

ex.chText: 那位参议员因热心公益事业而受到称赞。
ex.enText: The senator was commended for his public-spirited action.
His work has been highly commended.

synonyms.bx: 词义同 praise，但多用于正式文体。

ex.chText: 我的男朋友称赞我的新耳环。
ex.enText: My boyfriend complimented me on my new earrings.

ex.chText: 甚至连他的外教也夸奖他的法语棒极了。
ex.enText: Even his foreign teacher complimented him on his excellent French.

synonyms.bx: 指说好听的话，含恭维之意，多用于 compliment sb on sth 的结构中。

tr: clap one's hands or shout after performances to indicate approval

value.def: When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play or concert.

example.ex: Every person stood to applaud his unforgettable act of courage.
example.tran: 所有人起立为他不可磨灭的英勇之举鼓掌。

value.def: When an attitude or action is ap-plauded, people praise it.

example.ex: He should be applauded for his courage...
This last move can only be applauded...
example.tran: 最后这招令人拍手叫绝。

example.ex: She applauds the fact that they are promoting new ideas.
example.tran: 他们在宣传新思想，对此她表示赞许。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to clap hands 拍手, 鼓掌
rootsaffixes.title: plaud, plaus

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap 加强 + plaud 拍手，鼓掌 → 使劲鼓掌 → 拍手喝彩
ap 表加强 + plaus 拍手，鼓掌 + e，applaud 的名词 → 鼓掌
plaud 拍手，鼓掌 + it → 称赞
plaus 拍手，鼓掌 + ibility 易…性 → （论点等的）貌似有理
plaus 拍手，鼓掌 + ible 可…的 → 能鼓掌通过的 → （看似）可行的
